poem:
Breaking the Balance

Debt-burdened students
wandering hallways,
lectures laden
with unsteady futures.

Professors drift,
tenure slides
like mortar falling
from ancient walls.

We are the bookends
of a broken shelf,
trying to hold
a library crumbling.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Students and staff pay the price for university funding crisis | Letters For more than 15 years, university students and staff have borne the brunt of a broken system. Tuition fees helped turn higher education into a quasi-market, transforming students into indebted consumers and staff into precarious workers. Lord Mandelson’s support for Britain’s universities is welcome, but it is unfortunate that he appears relaxed about making students and staff pay the price – yet again". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
